Articles.Content:
KSP: 1.0.5.1028 Windows 7 64bit

Problem: Tracking station camera focus misalignment.

This seems silmilar to those errors which linux users were reported.

When I go into tracking station, camera does not focus on Kerbin and left side of the map shows nothing but black background.

I've experienced this error twice, and nothing but restarting game seemed to helps to resolve this issue.

I'm using 2560*1440 screen resoultion in OpenGL mod, as I'm playng heaviliy modded career game .

Look throung debug log(Alt+F2) as few mods I'm currently using doesn't officially supports 1.05.1028, couldn't find specifically suspicious. but I'm attaching it anyway.

I'll try to narrow down the mods so that whether any specific mod causes this problem or not.

Not just you: This seems to be system independent. Switch to windowed mode when looking at the tracking center: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/139247-Tracking-Center-Visual-Bug-FULLSCREEN

Hi,

Same problem here. Even the orbits of the vessels are not centered - their parameters (apoapsis, periapsis) seem ok, it's just the display. It kinds of snaps back into place when you zoom in a LOT. If I zoom out, even the planets orbits are out of place, like Kerbol is tacking a stroll between Moho and Eve ......

Thanks for the workaround, I'll try with it.

[EDIT]

Confirmed what Fido488 says.

Additionally, it happens if you alt-tab away (not necessarily in the tracking station) and then go back to the game. Just hit alt-enter to switch to window mode, then alt-enter again to go back to full screen, it may correct it. If not, maybe it's a problem with your resolution.

There are more details also here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138814-Bug-in-Tracking-Station-1-05

Edited November 12, 2015 by SnakyLeVrai
workaround confirmed and details
I've been playing in fullscreen mode, but I'll try windowed mode. Thanks guys.

I have exactly the same issue. Windows system, steam version, multi monitor.

Monitor 1 (game) 1920x1200 (16:10)

monitor 2 1280x1024 (4:3)

I never experienced the issue until 1.0.5 upgrade.

when I first enter the tracking station, the view is centered on kerbin with the orbits correctly drawn but the vessels out of them, displaced to the left. If I zoom out kerbin begins to go to the right and vessels to the left until one point in which the trajectories 'jump' and follow the vessels. If I fly one of the vessels and go to map view all shows ok.

i'll post some test with different resolutions and configs.

All of your problems i have too, i get all of it and i am on mac... BTW is anyone having a problem with parts stuck with the overheating bar? i have a mod that highlights the critical part but even in stock it stays with the heat bar even when it is long cooled down....

I hope these issues get fixed
This might be a stock issue.

[quote name='sal_vager'][U][URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138802-Kerbal-Space-Program-1-0-5-New-Issues-Repository#map_offset"]This might be a stock issue.[/URL][/U][/QUOTE]

Oh well, "alt-tab twice" in windows mode seems like a temporaly solution for me.

Hope it will get fixed in 1.1.
